bio_gene_expression.db_description: Biomedical gene expression database containing TPM (Transcripts Per Million) values from Zhang et al. (human patient samples) and VanDerSteen FL3C (lung cancer cell lines) datasets. Supports differential expression analysis between tumor/normal tissues and mutation-stratified cell lines.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Master table of all genes across both datasets. Contains unique gene identifiers, symbols, and descriptions. Use this table to find gene IDs or names. REQUIRED for ANY query involving gene names or gene-related filtering.
Query_Patterns: REQUIRED when user mentions any gene name (e.g., TP53, EGFR, KRAS)
REQUIRED for gene lookups, gene info queries, or any gene-based filtering
Always JOIN with gene_expression via gene_id to get expression data

Common_Joins.purpose: Link gene information to expression values
Common_Joins.example: FROM genes g INNER JOIN gene_expression ge ON g.gene_id = ge.gene_id WHERE g.gene_name = 'TP53'
FROM genes g INNER JOIN gene_statistics gs ON g.gene_id = gs.gene_id
FROM genes g INNER JOIN gene_comparison gc ON g.gene_id = gc.gene_id

gene_name.note: Users think in gene symbols (TP53) not IDs (ENSG00000141510). Always include gene_name in SELECT.

gene_id.note: Primary key for joins but usually not needed in final output.

Columns.Column_Description: Primary key. Unique gene identifier (e.g., ENSG00000141510 or TP53). Use for joining with expression data.
Gene symbol (e.g., TP53, EGFR, KRAS). This is the common name users will query. Case-insensitive search recommended. ALWAYS include this in SELECT clause for user readability.
Full gene description including function and aliases.
Chromosome location (e.g., 17, X, Y).
Type of gene: protein_coding, lncRNA, miRNA, etc.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Master table for all samples including human tissues and cell lines. Links to metadata tables based on sample_type. CRITICAL BRIDGE TABLE: Always use this when joining gene_expression to tissue/cell line metadata.
Query_Patterns: REQUIRED as bridge when joining gene_expression to human_tissue_metadata or cell_line_metadata
REQUIRED when user asks about sample types, groups, or dataset sources
Use sample_group column for quick tumor/normal/cell line grouping without full metadata joins

Common_Joins.purpose: Link sample info to expression data
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id

Common_Joins.purpose: Get detailed tissue/patient metadata (use LEFT JOIN because not all samples are human tissues)
Common_Joins.example: FROM samples s LEFT JOIN human_tissue_metadata htm ON s.sample_id = htm.sample_id WHERE s.sample_type = 'human_tissue'

Common_Joins.purpose: Get cell line mutation and proliferation data
Common_Joins.example: FROM samples s LEFT JOIN cell_line_metadata clm ON s.sample_id = clm.sample_id WHERE s.sample_type = 'cell_line'

required_for: Determining which metadata table to join

sample_group.note: Quick access to group classification. Use when you don't need detailed metadata.

Columns.Column_Description: Unique sample identifier. Format: NSLC.####.T/N for human tissues, cell_line_rep# for cell lines.
Type of sample: 'human_tissue' or 'cell_line'. Use to determine which metadata table to join.
Sample category: 'Tumor', 'Normal' (for human tissues), or 'Cell line'. Key for grouping in comparisons. Use this for quick tumor vs normal grouping.
Source dataset: 'zhang_2016' for human patient data, 'vandersteen_fl3c' for cell line data.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Extended metadata for human patient tissue samples from Zhang et al. Contains patient demographics and tissue characteristics. CRITICAL: This table is REQUIRED for ANY tumor vs normal comparisons, patient demographic analysis, or tissue type grouping.
Query_Patterns: REQUIRED when user asks about 'tumor vs normal', 'tumor versus normal', 'cancer vs healthy', or differential expression in tissues
REQUIRED when user asks about patient demographics (age, gender, smoking status)
REQUIRED when user wants to group by tissue_type or compare tissue groups
ALWAYS JOIN via samples table (gene_expression -> samples -> human_tissue_metadata)

Common_Joins.purpose: Link tissue metadata to sample records
Common_Joins.example: FROM human_tissue_metadata htm INNER JOIN samples s ON htm.sample_id = s.sample_id

Common_Joins.purpose: Get expression values WITH tissue type classification (tumor/normal)
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id LEFT JOIN human_tissue_metadata htm ON s.sample_id = htm.sample_id WHERE s.sample_type = 'human_tissue'

tissue_type.note: MUST SELECT this column when user asks for tumor vs normal comparisons. Use for GROUP BY to separate tumor and normal results.

subject_id.note: Use when analyzing matched tumor-normal pairs from same patient.

Columns.Column_Description: Links to samples.sample_id. One-to-one relationship with human_tissue samples.
Patient identifier (e.g., NSLC.0093). Multiple samples can come from same patient. Use for paired analysis.
Type of tissue: 'Tumor' or 'Normal'. CRITICAL: Use for tumor vs normal comparisons. Always include in SELECT and GROUP BY for comparative analysis.
Anatomical source or description of the tissue sample.
Age of patient at sample collection.
Patient gender: Male, Female, or Unknown.
Smoking history: Never, Former, Current, or Unknown.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Extended metadata for lung cancer cell lines from VanDerSteen FL3C dataset. Includes mutation profiles (EGFR, TP53, KRAS) and proliferation rates. CRITICAL: Required for mutation-stratified analysis or cell line characterization.
Query_Patterns: REQUIRED when user asks about cell lines, cell line characteristics, or in vitro models
REQUIRED when user asks about mutations (EGFR, TP53, KRAS), mutation status, or wildtype vs mutant comparisons
REQUIRED when user asks about proliferation, growth rate, or cancer subtype (histology)
ALWAYS JOIN via samples table (gene_expression -> samples -> cell_line_metadata)

Common_Joins.purpose: Link cell line metadata to sample records
Common_Joins.example: FROM cell_line_metadata clm INNER JOIN samples s ON clm.sample_id = s.sample_id

Common_Joins.purpose: Get expression values WITH mutation status or cell line characteristics
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id LEFT JOIN cell_line_metadata clm ON s.sample_id = clm.sample_id WHERE s.sample_type = 'cell_line'

TP53_status.note: MUST SELECT when user asks about TP53 mutations or p53 status.

EGFR_status.note: MUST SELECT when user asks about EGFR mutations.

KRAS_status.note: MUST SELECT when user asks about KRAS mutations.

histology.note: Use for grouping by cancer subtype.

Columns.Column_Description: Links to samples.sample_id. One-to-one relationship with cell_line samples.
Name of cell line (e.g., A427, A549, Calu-3). Multiple replicates may exist per cell line.
Cancer histology subtype (e.g., 'Lung Adenocarcinoma', 'Squamous Cell Carcinoma'). Use for subtype-specific analysis.
Numeric proliferation rate measured at 72 hours. Higher values = faster growth. Use for correlating expression with growth.
Categorical proliferation: 'slow', 'medium', or 'fast'. Use for grouping by growth rate.
EGFR mutation status: 'WT' (wildtype) or mutation notation (e.g., 'p.L858R'). CRITICAL: Always include in SELECT when user asks about EGFR mutations. Use for stratifying by EGFR status.
TP53 mutation status: 'WT' (wildtype) or mutation notation (e.g., 'p.M237I'). CRITICAL: Always include in SELECT when user asks about TP53 or p53 mutations. Use for stratifying by p53 status.
KRAS mutation status: 'WT' (wildtype) or mutation notation (e.g., 'p.G12D', 'p.G12S'). CRITICAL: Always include in SELECT when user asks about KRAS mutations. Use for stratifying by KRAS status.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Main fact table storing gene expression values (TPM) for all samples. Use this for raw expression queries. ALWAYS join with genes (to get gene names) and samples (to get sample metadata) for complete information. Never query this table alone.
Query_Patterns: REQUIRED for ANY expression-related query (levels, values, TPM)
ALWAYS join with genes table to filter by gene_name and include gene_name in results
ALWAYS join with samples table to get sample metadata
For tumor vs normal: gene_expression -> samples -> human_tissue_metadata
For mutation analysis: gene_expression -> samples -> cell_line_metadata

Common_Joins.purpose: Get gene names and filter by gene symbols
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN genes g ON ge.gene_id = g.gene_id WHERE g.gene_name = 'TP53'
Common_Joins.note: ALWAYS include this join. Users need gene names, not just IDs.

Common_Joins.purpose: Get sample type and group information
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id

Common_Joins.purpose: Get tissue type for tumor vs normal analysis
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id LEFT JOIN human_tissue_metadata htm ON s.sample_id = htm.sample_id
Common_Joins.when_required: When user asks for tumor vs normal, tissue classification, or patient data

Common_Joins.purpose: Get mutation status and cell line characteristics
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_expression ge INNER JOIN samples s ON ge.sample_id = s.sample_id LEFT JOIN cell_line_metadata clm ON s.sample_id = clm.sample_id
Common_Joins.when_required: When user asks about mutations, cell lines, or in vitro data

tpm_value.note: The main expression value. Use AVG(), MAX(), MIN() for aggregations.

sample_id.note: Include in SELECT if showing per-sample results.

Columns.Column_Description: Auto-incrementing unique identifier for each expression record. Usually not needed in results.
Links to genes.gene_id. Required for every expression record. Use for joining, not for display (use gene_name instead).
Links to samples.sample_id. Required for every expression record. Use for joining with samples table.
Expression level in TPM (Transcripts Per Million). Higher values = higher expression. Range: 0 to ~100,000. ALWAYS include this in SELECT for expression queries.
Source dataset: 'zhang_2016' or 'vandersteen_fl3c'. Use to filter by study or separate results by dataset.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Precomputed statistical summaries for gene expression grouped by sample groups. Use this for faster aggregate queries instead of computing on gene_expression. PREFERRED for queries asking for mean, median, or summary statistics.
Query_Patterns: PREFERRED when user asks for mean, median, average, or summary statistics
PREFERRED when user wants precomputed group comparisons (faster than aggregating gene_expression)
Use this instead of gene_expression when user needs aggregated data by group
ALWAYS join with genes to get gene_name

Common_Joins.purpose: Get gene names for statistics results
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_statistics gs INNER JOIN genes g ON gs.gene_id = g.gene_id WHERE g.gene_name = 'TP53' AND gs.sample_group IN ('Tumor', 'Normal')

required_for: Identifying which group the statistics represent
Robust central tendency (less affected by outliers)
median_tpm.note: Use when outliers might skew results.

n_samples.note: Always report how many samples contributed to statistics.

Columns.Column_Description: Unique identifier for each statistics record.
Links to genes.gene_id.
Source dataset: 'zhang_2016' or 'vandersteen_fl3c'.
Group for aggregation: 'Tumor', 'Normal', 'Cell line', or histology subtypes. ALWAYS include in SELECT to identify groups.
Number of samples in this group. ALWAYS include for transparency.
Mean expression (TPM) across samples in this group. Primary statistic for comparisons.
Median expression (TPM) across samples in this group. Use for robust central tendency.
Variance of expression across samples. Use for variability analysis.
Standard deviation of expression across samples. Use for reporting variability.
Minimum expression value in this group.
Maximum expression value in this group.
25th percentile (first quartile) of expression.
75th percentile (third quartile) of expression. Use with q25 for IQR.

db_column_description.Table_Description: Differential expression analysis results comparing gene expression between groups (e.g., Tumor vs Normal). Use for finding upregulated or downregulated genes. PREFERRED when user asks for fold change, differential expression, or significantly changed genes.
Query_Patterns: PREFERRED when user asks for 'upregulated', 'downregulated', 'differentially expressed', or 'fold change'
Use when user wants to compare groups (tumor vs normal, mutant vs wildtype)
Filter by fold_change or log2_fold_change thresholds for significance
ALWAYS join with genes to get gene_name

Common_Joins.purpose: Get gene names for comparison results
Common_Joins.example: FROM gene_comparison gc INNER JOIN genes g ON gc.gene_id = g.gene_id WHERE gc.comparison_type = 'Tumor_vs_Normal' AND ABS(gc.log2_fold_change) > 1

log2_fold_change.note: Positive = upregulated in group_1, negative = downregulated. |log2FC| > 1 is typically significant (2-fold change).

fold_change.note: Use when user specifically asks for 'X-fold change'. log2_fold_change is more standard.

Columns.Column_Description: Unique identifier for each comparison record.
Links to genes.gene_id.
Source dataset for this comparison.
Type of comparison (e.g., 'Tumor_vs_Normal', 'KRAS_mutant_vs_WT'). ALWAYS include in SELECT.
First group in comparison (numerator for fold change). Include for clarity.
Second group in comparison (denominator for fold change). Include for clarity.
Linear fold change (group_1 / group_2). >1 = upregulated in group_1, <1 = downregulated.
Log2 fold change. Positive = upregulated in group_1, negative = downregulated. |log2FC| > 1 is typically significant (2-fold change). PREFERRED metric for differential expression.
Statistical p-value for differential expression (if computed). <0.05 typically considered significant.
Adjusted p-value (FDR corrected). Use this for multiple testing correction. Preferred over raw p_value.
